intro: Biauricula devillei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. Biauricula devillei prefers well-draining soil and consistent humidity to thrive.
